p: ROS changes could reflect the status of oxidative function, which can be a measure of oxidative tissue and cell damage (Li et al. 2019). The results of DHE-ROS measurement revealed that RosA could significantly reduce ROS production in myocardial I/R injury areas (225.6 ± 37.1% vs. 319.7 ± 27.1%, Figure 6(A,C)). Additionally, RosA was found to reduce ROS production following OGD/R injury in cells (213.9 ± 32.2% vs. 379.1 ± 44.2%, Figure 6(B,D)).
